title: Editor's Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Tue Apr 17, 2018 | 8:50am EDT Editor's Choice Pictures 
Adult-film actress Stephanie Clifford, also known as Stormy Daniels, arrives at federal court in the Manhattan borough of New York City, New York. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Adult-film actress Stephanie Clifford, also known as Stormy Daniels, arrives at federal court in the Manhattan borough of New York City, New York. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson Close 1 / 24 
Protestors demonstrate inside a Center City Starbucks, where two black men were arrested, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Mark Makela Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Protestors demonstrate inside a Center City Starbucks, where two black men were arrested, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Mark Makela Close 2 / 24 
Jazmin, 9, carries a cardboard car to be used in a play in her school at Anapra neighborhood in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Reuters / Tuesday, April 17, 2018 Jazmin, 9, carries a cardboard car to be used in a play in her school at Anapra neighborhood in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Close 3 / 24 
David, 5, a Central American migrant boy from El Salvador, moving in a caravan through Mexico, is carried to the hospital with symptoms of pneumonia while he was waiting to try and board a freight train, in Irapuato, in Guanajuato state, Mexico.... more Reuters / Tuesday, April 17, 2018 David, 5, a Central American migrant boy from El Salvador, moving in a caravan through Mexico, is carried to the hospital with symptoms of pneumonia while he was waiting to try and board a freight train, in Irapuato, in Guanajuato   4 / 24 
Desiree Linden of the U.S. celebrates after winning the women's division of the 122nd Boston Marathon in Boston, Massachusetts. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Desiree Linden of the U.S. celebrates after winning the women's division of the 122nd Boston Marathon in Boston, Massachusetts. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Close 5 / 24 
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, his wife Ri Sol Ju and Song Tao, head of the International Department of Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee, applaud with ballet dancers in this undated photo released by North Korea's Korean Central... more Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, his wife Ri Sol Ju and Song Tao, head of the International Department of Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee, applaud with ballet dancers in this undated   (KCNA) in Pyongyang. KCNA/via Reuters Close 6 / 24 
A boy walks along a damaged street at the city of Douma in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/Omar Sanadiki Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 A boy walks along a damaged street at the city of Douma in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/Omar Sanadiki Close 7 / 24 
Aurora, an eight-year-old female polar bear, swims in a pool which was recently filled with water after the winter season, at the Royev Ruchey zoo in the suburb of Krasnoyarsk, Russia. REUTERS/Ilya Naymushin Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Aurora, an eight-year-old female polar bear, swims in a pool which was recently filled with water after the winter season, at the Royev Ruchey zoo in the suburb of Krasnoyarsk, Russia. REUTERS/Ilya Naymushin Close 8 / 24 
Sumo wrestlers perform a show fight during an annual sumo tournament dedicated to the Yasukuni Shrine in Tokyo, Japan. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Sumo wrestlers perform a show fight during an annual sumo tournament dedicated to the Yasukuni Shrine in Tokyo, Japan. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Close 9 / 24 
A demonstrator is detained by police during a protest against Armenia's ruling Republican party's nomination of former President Serzh Sarksyan as its candidate for prime minister, in Yerevan, Armenia. Photolure/Hayk Baghdasaryan via REUTERS Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 A demonstrator is detained by police during a protest against Armenia's ruling Republican party's nomination of former President Serzh Sarksyan as its candidate for prime minister, in Yerevan, Armenia. Photolure/Hayk Baghdasaryan via REUTERS Close 10 / 24 
A satellite image shows the Barzah Research and Development Center after being struck by U.S. and coalition operations in Damascus, Syria. Satellite Image �DigitalGlobe/Handout via REUTERS Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 A satellite image shows the Barzah Research and Development Center after being struck by U.S. and coalition operations in Damascus, Syria. Satellite Image �DigitalGlobe/Handout via REUTERS Close 11 / 24 
An Ultra Orthodox Jewish man looks at an Israeli Air Force aerobatic team flying in formation during a rehearsal for an aerial show for Israel's 70th Independence Day celebrations, in Jerusalem. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 An Ultra Orthodox Jewish man looks at an Israeli Air Force aerobatic team flying in formation during a rehearsal for an aerial show for Israel's 70th Independence Day celebrations, in Jerusalem. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Close 12 / 24 
Greek Communist Party supporters clash with police as they try to bring down a statue of former U.S. President Harry Truman during a demonstration against air strikes on Syria by the United States, Britain and France, in Athens, Greece. REUTERS/Alkis... more Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Greek Communist Party supporters clash with police as they try to bring down a statue of former U.S. President Harry Truman during a demonstration against air strikes on Syria by the United States, Britain and France, in Athens, Greece. REUTERS/Alkis Konstantinidis Close 
Men make bricks in Bunia, Ituri province, eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. REUTERS/Goran Tomasevic Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Men make bricks in Bunia, Ituri province, eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. REUTERS/Goran Tomasevic Close 14 / 24 
A woman stands behind a curtain inside a temporary shelter after a fire broke out in a Rohingya camp in New Delhi, India. REUTERS/Adnan Abidi Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 A woman stands behind a curtain inside a temporary shelter after a fire broke out in a Rohingya camp in New Delhi, India. REUTERS/Adnan Abidi Close 15 / 24 
Katherine, 14, a Central American migrant from Guatemala, moving in a caravan through Mexico, poses with her drawing at improvised shelter, in Irapuato, in Guanajuato   Monday, April 16, 2018 Katherine, 14, a Central American migrant from Guatemala, moving in a caravan through Mexico, poses with her drawing at improvised shelter, in Irapuato, in Guanajuato   16 / 24 
Yuki Kawauchi of Japan celebrates after winning the men's division of the 122nd Boston Marathon in Boston, Massachusetts. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Yuki Kawauchi of Japan celebrates after winning the men's division of the 122nd Boston Marathon in Boston, Massachusetts. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Close 17 / 24 
The Boeoegg, a snowman made of wadding and filled with firecrackers, stands atop a bonfire in the Sechselaeuten square in Zurich, Switzerland. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 The Boeoegg, a snowman made of wadding and filled with firecrackers, stands atop a bonfire in the Sechselaeuten square in Zurich, Switzerland. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann Close 18 / 24 
Mount Sinabung volcano spews volcanic ash into the air during an eruption in Karo, North Sumatra, Indonesia April 15, 2018 in this photo taken by Antara Foto. Antara Foto/Maz Yons/ via REUTERS Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 Mount Sinabung volcano spews volcanic ash into the air during an eruption in Karo, North Sumatra, Indonesia April 15, 2018 in this photo taken by Antara Foto. Antara Foto/Maz Yons/ via REUTERS Close 19 / 24 
A man holds up a photo of assassinated anti-  Galizia during a vigil and demonstration, marking six months since her murder in a car bomb, in Valletta,   Monday, April 16, 2018 A man holds up a photo of assassinated anti-  Galizia during a vigil and demonstration, marking six months since her murder in a car bomb, in Valletta,   20 / 24 
Han Min-ja and Yang Won-ju dance at the New Hyundai Core colatec in Seoul, South Korea. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 Han Min-ja and Yang Won-ju dance at the New Hyundai Core colatec in Seoul, South Korea. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji Close 21 / 24 
Miranda Lambert poses backstage with her awards including her 10th consecutive Female Vocalist of the Year award during the 53rd Academy of Country Music Awards in Las Vegas, Nevada. REUTERS/Steve Marcus Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Miranda Lambert poses backstage with her awards including her 10th consecutive Female Vocalist of the Year award during the 53rd Academy of Country Music Awards in Las Vegas, Nevada. REUTERS/Steve Marcus Close 22 / 24 
Copies of former FBI director James Comey's book "A Higher Loyalty" are seen at Kramerbooks book store in Washington D.C.. REUTERS/Carlos Barria Reuters / Tuesday, April 17, 2018 Copies of former FBI director James Comey's book "A Higher Loyalty" are seen at Kramerbooks book store in Washington D.C.. REUTERS/Carlos Barria Close 23 / 24 
Police officers monitor activity outside as protestors demonstrate inside a Center City Starbucks, where two black men were arrested, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Mark Makela Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Police officers monitor activity outside as protestors demonstrate inside a Center City Starbucks, where two black men were arrested, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Mark Makela Close
